captions.text:
You told me
you don't remember,

So how do you know
about her neck?

I was going
to let it go.

You was looking
so happy just now,

But to tell you
the truth,

'cause I have been
dying to tell you.

Who you'd want to
hear it from.

I'll let you in on
a little secret.

It don't matter who
you hear it from.

I--I j-just had
to kill linda,

Th-that cunt just got
what she deserved.

Cutting up that
son of a bitch rushman?

That was just
a fucking work of art.

You're good.
You are really good.

I did get caught,
though, didn't I?

title: Primal Fear (9/9) Movie CLIP - Good For You, Marty (1996) HD

comments.text: damn ROY!!!!!!﻿
comments.author: 李云

comments.text:
Words cant describe how great this film was with every single actor playing 
a great role. Obviously ed nortons was the stand out performance, i think 
he was just as good in this as american history x. Fight Club will go down 
in history as 1 of the best satire/indie films, but i thought that brad 
pitt played a better performance than ed in fight club. Out of the 3 films 
it is so hard to choose which one is my favourite but i would have to say 
american history x.﻿
comments.author: Al “Walkman162742” Pacino

comments.text:
I found Edward Norton so damn hot and brilliant in Birdman that I had to go 
watch this movie. I see that his hotness is not a new thing. Oh la la. Poor 
Linda though.﻿
comments.author: Empressoftheflames

comments.text:
Um, apparently he doesn't realize that he just admitted to murdering Linda. 
He could get tried for that, and actually get convicted this time, seeing

comments.author: MrOneofthousands1994

comments.text:
Richard Gere's character was supposed to take the case back to trial and 
use what Roy just said against them. But the filmmakers thought they should 
go with this ending, since they thought the movie should be about the 
lawyer getting screwed over.
comments.author: L

comments.text:
+Mark Robinson I'm pretty sure that's not how attorney-client privilege 
works. I think if he straight-up admits to murder, then the attorney has 
the right, if not the obligation, to disclose the information.
comments.author: MrOneofthousands1994

comments.text:
Attorney-client confidentiality. He could admit to shooting the President 
and it still wouldn't matter.
comments.author: Mark Robinson

comments.text: they don't make movies like this anymore...﻿
comments.author: twelve98

comments.text:
+twelve98 Movies are still good okay. If you think movies are bad take a 
look at a lineup of movies during 1996-2001. Movies like this were an 
exception, but for the most part, that was the dark age of cinema. You see 
allot better movies today than you did back than. Don't believe me? Ever 
see Drive? 12 Years A Slave? Schopdie New York? (hope I spelled that right) 
No Country For Old Men? I mean shit if these weren't great years for film 
than I don't know what great is anymore. Don't get me wrong, we do get our 
fair share of shit, like Micheal Bay's explosion fests, and some crappy 
"horror" and "parody" movies. But it was very common back then. We got 
movies like Space Jam, Twister, Independance Day, Godzilla, and many others 
that we're ether shit or below average.

comments.text:
There were a couple of reasons Roy might've killed Linda. Linda played with 
Roy's emotions and made him think she was his girlfriend when she slept

intending to kill the archbishop. He wanted all evidence of the sex tape to 
disappear to remove all motive for him.

apart.
I took about a minute coming up with that. I think there may be some 
message better explained if analyzed long enough.﻿
